item.title: 关于英特尔持续不断的混乱的更多内容（播客）
item.description: 美国正在大力发展半导体制造业。英特尔是美国最大的半导体制造商。但有一个问题。英特尔一直在努力使其工厂及时、高效地运转起来。那么问题出在哪里，公司能否扭转局面呢？在本期的 "Lots More "节目中，我们将与伯恩斯坦研究公司的斯泰西-拉斯冈（Stacy Rasgon）和彭博新闻社的麦肯齐-霍金斯（Mackenzie Hawkins）讨论英特尔当前的困境和未来的发展。【原文：The US is in the midst of a big effort to bring more semiconductor manufacturing onshore. Intel is the biggest US semiconductor manufacturer. There’s just one problem. Intel has really been struggling to get its fab operations up and running in a timely, efficient manner. So what’s the problem, and can the company turn things around? On this episode of Lots More, we speak to Stacy Rasgon of Bernstein Research and Mackenzie Hawkins of Bloomberg News to discuss the current struggles and future pro】

item.title: 斯里兰卡新领导人在首次国际货币基金组织会议上呼吁减税
item.description: 斯里兰卡新总统在上任后与国际货币基金组织官员的首次会晤中坚持了他的竞选承诺，即减少税收并为公民提供其他救济。【原文：Sri Lanka’s new president stuck to his campaign promises of reducing taxes and providing other relief to citizens in his first meeting with officials from the International Monetary Fund since taking office.】

item.title: 新兴市场债券关注薪资数据寻求新动力
item.description: 新兴市场美元债券的反弹正在等待下一个催化剂，周五晚些时候公布的美国非农就业数据可能会带来这一催化剂。【原文：The rally in emerging-market dollar bonds is awaiting its next catalyst, which may arrive with the US non-farm payrolls data due later Friday.】

item.title: 投资者等待美国就业数据，欧洲股市走高
item.description: 欧洲股市周五开盘走高，在美国就业数据公布前扭转了本周的部分跌势，该数据可能会让投资者更清楚地了解美联储的下一步行动。【原文：European stocks ticked higher at the open on Friday, reversing some of the week’s losses ahead of US jobs data which could give investors better clarity about the Federal Reserve’s next move.】

item.title: 印度皮拉马尔制药公司的目标是在五年内实现收入翻番
item.description: 皮拉马尔制药有限公司主席南迪尼-皮拉马尔（Nandini Piramal）表示，该公司预计新分子的开发和肯塔基州无菌注射剂工厂 8000 万美元的扩建将支撑其未来五年收入翻番的目标。【原文：Piramal Pharma Ltd. expects new molecule development and an $80 million expansion of its sterile injectable facility in Kentucky to underpin its goal of doubling revenues in the next five years, according to its Chairperson Nandini Piramal.】

item.title: 会议记录显示大多数捷克央行行长对通胀风险保持警惕
item.description: 根据上次政策会议的记录，大多数捷克央行董事会成员都认为经济中存在一些持续的通胀压力，因此需要采取谨慎的降息步伐。【原文：Most Czech central bank board members saw some persistent inflationary pressures in the economy, which warranted a cautious pace of interest-rate cuts, according to minutes from the last policy meeting.】

item.title: 西班牙太阳能供应过剩可能会抑制一些新项目的实施
item.description: 据极光能源研究有限公司（Aurora Energy Research Ltd.）称，今年西班牙太阳能发电供过于求，将价格压得很低，一些项目可能因盈利能力下降而无法建设。【原文：An oversupply of solar power in Spain has pushed prices so low this year that some projects may not be built due to a drop in profitability, according to Aurora Energy Research Ltd.】

item.title: 随着改革取得进展，韩国债券离岸交易量增至三倍
item.description: 上个月，韩国债券的离岸交易量几乎增加了两倍，这进一步表明，为增加该国加入主要国际债务指数的机会而进行的改革正在产生效果。【原文：Offshore trading in South Korean bonds nearly tripled last month, adding to signs that reforms undertaken to boost the country’s chances of joining a major international debt index are having an effect.】

item.title: 新加坡要求奢侈品销售商在洗钱风波后采取更多措施
item.description: 新加坡正在敦促该国的房地产中介、宝石交易商和豪华汽车销售商更加积极主动地标记可疑客户，这是该国打击洗钱行动的一部分。【原文：Singapore is urging the country’s real estate agents, gemstone dealers and luxury car sellers to be more proactive in flagging suspicious customers, part of the country’s move to fight money laundering.】

item.title: 花旗银行称里拉走强似乎抑制了土耳其的资金流入
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）的一位高级官员称，土耳其里拉的相对强势可能会阻碍主要投资组合的流入，即使在向正统货币政策转变这一里程碑式的举措受到投资者欢呼之后也是如此。【原文：The relative strength of Turkey’s lira may be holding back major portfolio inflows even after a landmark shift to orthodox monetary policies that was cheered by investors, according to a senior Citigroup Inc. official.】

item.title: 欧盟将就针对中国电动汽车的关税进行表决
item.description: 欧盟成员国将于周五投票决定是否对来自中国的电动汽车征收高达 45% 的关税，这一决定可能会进一步加剧与中国政府的紧张关系。【原文：The European Union’s member states are set to vote Friday on whether to impose tariffs as high as 45% on electric vehicles from China, a decision that could threaten to further ratchet up tensions with Beijing.】

item.title: 股市反弹提振需求，港元成为罕见焦点
item.description: 随着在香港交易所上市的中国股票大幅反弹，需求飙升，香港沉睡已久的货币终于走出了冬眠期。【原文：Hong Kong’s long-dormant currency has come out of hibernation, as demand soars following a remarkable rally in Chinese stocks listed on the city’s bourse.】

item.title: Seven & I 接触零售、超市单位的买家
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Seven & i Holdings Co.公司已就其伊藤洋华堂商店和超市与潜在买家进行了接触，以寻求重组，应对加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.【原文：Seven & i Holdings Co. has approached potential buyers for its Ito-Yokado stores and supermarkets as it seeks to restructure in the face of a takeover approach from Canada’s Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc., people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.description: 法国和意大利希望从企业身上榨取更多税收，以控制臃肿的预算赤字，并确保其在债券投资者心目中的信誉。【原文：France and Italy want to squeeze more tax from companies to bring bloated budget deficits under control and ensure their credibility with bond investors.】

item.description: 自中国宣布经济刺激计划以来，中国科技股大幅上扬。而这一次，它可能是真的。【原文：Chinese tech stocks have had a tremendous rally since the nation announced its stimulus spree. And this time, it may be real.】

item.title: 香港中国股市攀升，交易员评估动能
item.description: 由于交易员们在评估 16 年来最大涨势的可持续性，香港中国股市在上午的交易中震荡走高。【原文：Chinese stocks in Hong Kong edged higher in a volatile morning session as traders assessed the sustainability of the biggest rally in 16 years.】

item.title: 韩国电视剧巨头 CJ 每年斥资 7.5 亿美元对抗好莱坞
item.description: 韩国最大的娱乐公司 CJ ENM Co. 计划每年在内容方面投入 1 万亿韩元（约合 7.5 亿美元），以更好地与好莱坞竞争，并使其业务摆脱困境。【原文：CJ ENM Co. plans to spend 1 trillion won ($750 million) annually on content, as South Korea’s largest entertainment company tries to better compete with Hollywood and pull its business out of a funk.】

item.title: 美国码头工人暂停罢工后亚洲航运股下跌
item.description: 美国东海岸和海湾沿岸港口的码头工人同意暂停罢工，抑制了集装箱运价因供应减少而上涨的预期，亚洲各地的航运股因此下滑。【原文：Shipping stocks across Asia slumped after dockworkers at US East and Gulf coast ports agreed to suspend their strike, curbing expectations container rates will increase due to reduced supply.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 公司因社交媒体罚款与澳大利亚打官司败诉
item.description: 澳大利亚一名法官驳回了社交媒体平台 X 公司试图抹去监管机构处以的 61.05 万澳元（41.81 万美元）罚款的请求，这是该国在与全球互联网公司的斗争中取得的一个显著胜利。【原文：An Australian judge rejected an attempt by social media platform X to wipe a A$610,500 ($418,100) fine levied by a watchdog, a notable victory in the country’s battle with global internet companies.】
